turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Quality Score.
turn.1: What is the difference between Quality Score and Ad Rank?
turn.2: Quality Score Quality Score is a metric used by Google, Yahoo! (called "Quality Index"), and Bing that influences ad rank and cost per click (CPC) of ads.
turn.4: To determine the position of the ad on a search engine, each ad is allocated using a process which takes into account the bid and the Quality Score.
turn.5: What are some other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Ads are then listed in descending order based on the result of that equation.
turn.7: Is there any additional information on the Ad Rank?
turn.8: The exact weight of Quality Score versus bid has not been revealed by any of the major search engines, and each company has stated that they reserve the right to continually adjust their ranking methodologies.
turn.9: What about the Quality Score, what did you find interesting?
turn.10: In late 2008, Google revealed that Quality Score was used to determine which ads it would show above organic results, and that a high quality score could actually cause ads to jump over ads with lower quality scores that would otherwise not merit that prominent placement.
turn.11: Is there any other information on the Ad Rank?
turn.12: The major search engines have each independently implemented efforts to maintain and improve the quality of ads listed on their sites.
